page.title: 02Tabernacle Chapel,Pontypridd
page.content: This Welsh Baptist Chapel was built in 1810 near the Old Bridge in Pontypridd The present Coed-y-lan Primary School started in Tabernacle on Feb.6th 1893. The chapel is now being converted into a historical/cultural centre.The basement will be used by local societies.On the ground floor and in the gallery there will be exhibitions showing the history of Pontypridd; maps,books and photographs of the old town and district.The beautiful organ, which was installed in 1910,is to remain but will be converted into an electronic organ.The decorated ceiling and stained glass windows are being restored.The total cost of the work is estimated at Â£250,000.Pontypridd town council is paying for the interior work and the EEC for the exterior.It is hoped that the centre will open on Mar 1st 1986. (from Coed-y-lan school)
